titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Education Studies, Yale College, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:51

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of student files documenting the Education Studies program at Yale College, formerly known as the Teacher Preparation and Placement Program.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Teacher Preparation and Placement Program, Yale University, Records (RU 179).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of student files documenting the Education Studies program at Yale College, formerly known as the Teacher Preparation and Placement Program.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Education Studies, Yale College, Records (RU 1122). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the materials is restricted. See collection contents for details.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 9-E (YRG 9-E), Records documenting Yale College offices, programs, and projects.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
